intro: Schizochilus woodii, commonly known as the African orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its unique, fragrant, and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and requires a humid, shaded environment to thrive. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Schizochilus woodii is considered a conservation concern.
